overview_of_class: This class will examine the most fundamental ideas in physics, including those from classical physics, quantum mechanics, Einstein's relativity, nuclear physics, the latest notions in cosmology, and much more. Emphasis will be placed on how these ideas fit into a historical context. We will study the subject from the "ground up" - no prior physics education is needed. Students should be comfortable with simple algebra.
name: Ideas of Physics
title: WCAS PHYSICS 103-0-1 Ideas of Physics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This class will examine the most fundamental ideas in physics, including those from classical physics, quantum mechanics, Einstein's relativity, nuclear physics, the latest notions in cosmology, and much more. Emphasis will be placed on how these ideas fit into a historical context. We will study the subject from the "ground up" - no prior physics education is needed. Students should be comfortable with simple algebra.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: To gain a good perspective of the major ideas in physics and how they have come about over the centuries.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: One or more midterm examinations, homework, and a final examination.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: This class is not intended for students who have taken Physics 130 or 135. It is intended for non-science majors.
